newsitem.title: UK: UK government orders quick review of PFI.
newsitem.headline: UK government orders quick review of PFI.

text.p: The new British government on Thursday ordered a speedy review of the Private Finance Initiative (PFI) process under which companies bid to undertake projects for the public sector.
Junior Treasury minister Geoffrey Robinson also announced he was ending the "universal testing" rule under which government departments have to test all projects for PFI potential.
Robinson said he had asked Malcolm Bates, chairman of electronic components group Premier Farnell and of the Pearl Group, to conduct the PFI review, which should be completed by June 13.
"I want to know what are the obstacles in the way of bringing projects to fruition and how the whole process can be streamlined," Robinson said in a statement.
He added that the so-called universal testing rule "has been a recipe for frustration and delay and works against the concept of prioritisation which we want to build into the process."
"Departments should not spend time and money trying to develop models for private finance where these will not work," Robinson said. -- London Newsroom +44 171 5427767
